cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across Hispaniola, then near the Turks & Caicos and the SE Bahamas Thursday, skirting or just north of central Cuba Friday, entering the Straits of Florida late Friday/early Saturday and then turning northwest into the eastern Gulf toward the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near the Alabama/Florida border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Haiti northern coast, Turks & Caicos, southeastern Bahamas, and the Cuban provinces from Ciego de Avila eastward
weather_observation.warning_coast: Dominican Republic south coast from Punta Palenque eastward and north coast east of the Haiti border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, southeastern and central Bahamas, northern Cuba, South Florida/Florida Keys, eastern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Up to a 10% chance of tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds late Saturday into Sunday; otherwise breezy with gusts 25–35 kt possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along Biscayne Bay and exposed Atlantic beaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals to 8 inches could cause urban and poor-drainage flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Atlantic beaches beginning Friday night.
